content.title: Dr Ambedkar Central Sector Scheme of Interest Subsidy on Educational Loans for Overseas Studies for Other Backward Classes (OBCs) and Economically Backward Classes (EBCs)
content.department: Ministry Of Social Justice and Empowerment
content.beneficiary: Students belonging to OBCs and EBCs
content.details: The scheme provides interest subsidy to the students belonging to the OBCs and EBCs on the interest payable for the period of the moratorium for the Education Loans for overseas studies to pursue approved courses of studies abroad at Masters, M.Phil. and PhD level.
benefits: Interest payable by the students availing the education loans of the IBA for the period of moratorium shall be borne by the Government of India.
The eligible loan component shall be the actual loan taken subject to a maximum of ₹ 20,00,000 for the purpose of an Interest subsidy claim.
eligibility: The applicant should be a Student.
The student should have secured admission in the approved course at Masters, M.Phil or PhD levels abroad.
The applicant should have availed loan from a scheduled bank under the Education Loan Scheme of the Indian Banks Association (IBA).
The total income of the applicant shall not exceed ₹ 8,00,000 per annum.
content.application_process: The interest Subsidy shall be linked with the existing Educational Loan Scheme of the Indian Banks Association (IBA) and restricted to students enrolled for courses at Master, M.Phil and PhD levels. The Nodal Bank will lay down the detailed procedure for processing and sanctioning interest subsidies to eligible students.
documents_required: OBC Caste certificate in the prescribed Performa issued by the competent authority.
Income certificate produced by the student for availing Educational Loan.
Details of the Aadhaar-linked Bank Account.

faqs.question: Is there a separate fund allocation for female students under the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, at least 50% of the total allocation is reserved for female students, but it can be used for male students if there is insufficient demand from female students.

faqs.question: Can the subsidy be provided for courses that are partly in India and partly abroad?
faqs.answer: Yes, if the degree is awarded by a foreign university, the course is eligible for interest subsidy.

faqs.question: Can students increase the moratorium period if they have valid reasons?
faqs.answer: Yes, with approval from the competent authority, students can extend the moratorium period.

faqs.question: Is there any central authority that monitors the scheme's performance?
faqs.answer: Yes, the Ministry of Social Justice and Empowerment monitors the performance of the scheme.

faqs.question: Are candidates from State/UT Lists eligible for the interest subsidy under the scheme?
faqs.answer: No, only candidates from the Central List of OBCs are eligible for the interest subsidy.

faqs.question: Is there a mechanism for periodic evaluation of the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, the financial and physical performance of the scheme is periodically evaluated through studies conducted by reputed institutions/agencies.

faqs.question: Is there any provision for minor modifications or changes in the scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, minor modifications or changes with no financial implications can be made by the Competent Authority.

faqs.question: How is a student's eligibility for the interest subsidy determined if they are employed?
faqs.answer: Parental income for eligibility is considered only when the student is unemployed or on sabbatical without receiving a salary.

faqs.question: What happens if the student's income increases or decreases after the loan is sanctioned?
faqs.answer: The income certificate submitted during the loan application is treated as proof of annual income, and subsequent changes do not affect eligibility.

faqs.question: Are there any specific disciplines or fields covered under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Yes, various disciplines, including Arts/Humanities/Social Sciences, Engineering, Medical, and more are covered.

faqs.question: How can one access the Central List of OBCs to check eligibility?
faqs.answer: The Central List of OBCs is available on the National Commission for Backward Classes (NCBC) website.

faqs.question: What is the definition of 'meritorious students' under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Meritorious students are those who have taken admission in accredited Universities/Institutions abroad.

faqs.question: What is the maximum eligible loan component for interest subsidy?
faqs.answer: The maximum eligible loan component is the actual loan taken, subject to a maximum of Rs. 20.00 lakh.

faqs.question: Which agency is responsible for implementing this scheme?
faqs.answer: The Nodal Bank implements this scheme as per the Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) between the Banks and the Ministry of Social Justice & Empowerment.
